page.title: 19NEWSPAPER HEADLINES
page.content: Local Newspaper headlines on Wednesday October 16, 1985. CHILDREN-don't talk to strangers. Vale of Clwyd parents and children have been warned to be on their guard after a "stranger" offered a lift home to a boy aged eight .... SCANNER APPEAL LOOKS SET TO MEET Â£72,000 TARGET. Glyndwr District is running ahead of schedule in its fundraising efforts for the Clwyd Hospital Body Scanner Appeal with more than Â£60,000 already in the coffers by the end of last month. SOME ONLY GO FOR THE BEER. An attack on councilors who attend conferences and meetings merely for the money to be made from expenses, was made at last week's Glyndwr District Council meeting.
